message: No one said money buys happiness or intelligence.

The Yeti

Awe. Once again someone basis their opinions on what the media told them. New Orleans is my home. And just like any place it has it's good and bad. You based your opinion on what the media saw as a story. Not the truth. We live away from the city at the time. We still sat without electricity or running water for weeks!!! We weren't even part of the evacuated area. We literally lived in Vienna sausages and Spam from a can. And we rationed our bottled water and still feared starvation and dehydration. The heat was 100 degrees and we didn't even have a way to use a fan. Do you happen to remember the media reports about FEMA??? They took weeks to respond and give aid? No I guess you don't remember all of that. But I do.

Good morning. I encourage you all to learn about our history concerning #StandingRock, #NorthDakota and the #Lakota. You see this behavior by the United States government isn't anything new. It's not the first time our government has wanted natural resources that lay beneath native ground and on their land. In 1890 the US government massacred Sitting Bull and HUNDREDS of his people for access to mine gold. This isn't the first time they have incited violence on peaceful people to succeed in gaining land rights. There is nothing that is ok with the actions taken these past months by the private security forces hired, local and state police and our national guard. The global community needs to step in...or WE need to step in. History is repeating itself right under us. We know how it ends. Let's not forget. #WoundedKnee #PineRidge #IncidentAtOglala #FreeLeonardPeltier #JohnTrudell #RussellMeans
